snippet: Federal regulators approved one flight of a Boeing 787, with a crew but no passengers, as engineers study ways to reduce the risks of another battery fire.
abstract: Federal Aviation Administration approves one flight of a Boeing 787, with flight crew but no passengers, as company's engineers study possible changes to plane's electrical systems that could reduce risk of another battery fire.

byline.original: By CHRISTOPHER DREW and JAD MOUAWAD

lead_paragraph: Federal regulators approved one flight of a Boeing 787, with a crew but no passengers, as engineers study ways to reduce the risks of another battery fire.

headline.main: Crew-Only 787 Flight Is Approved by F.A.A.
headline.print_headline: Crew-Only 787 Flight Is Approved By F.A.A.
